Prep Time: 15 Minutes
Cook Time: 45 Minutes
Ready In: 1 Hour
Servings: 4

INGREDIENTS:
2/3 cup dry potato flakes
1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 teaspoon garlic salt
1 (3 pound) chicken, skin removed, cut into pieces
1/3 cup butter, melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease or line with foil a baking sheet or
a 13 x 9 inch baking pan.

2. In a medium bowl, combine potato flakes, Parmesan cheese, and garlic salt. Stir until
well mixed.

3. Dip chicken pieces into melted butter or margarine, and roll in potato flake mixture to
coat. Place in prepared pan.

4. Bake for 45 to 60 minutes, or until chicken is tender and golden brown. The smaller
the pieces, the faster they will cook.

--------Alternative------------------


INGREDIENTS:
2/3 cup bread crumbs
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 teaspoon garlic salt
4 chicken breasts, skin removed, cut into pieces
1/3 cup butter, melted

DIRECTIONS:
1. Heat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease or line with foil a baking sheet or
a 13 x 9 inch baking pan.

2. In a medium bowl, combine bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and garlic salt. Stir until
well mixed.

3. Dip chicken pieces into melted butter or margarine, and roll in potato flake mixture to
coat. Place in prepared pan.

4. Bake for 30 to 60 minutes, or until chicken is tender and golden brown. The smaller
the pieces, the faster they will cook
